Uses of Package
graph

  • Packages that use graph 
    Package Description
    graph
    graph package: a collection of classes for representing graphs, hyper-graphs and algorithms operating on such discrete finite structures.
    graph.coarsening
    package defines abstract classes and implements algorithms for coarsening graphs.
    graph.packing
    Optimization package that obtains near-optimal solution to the 1- and 2-packing combinatorial optimization problem.
    graph.partitioning
    Package defines interfaces and implements algorithms for graph and hyper-graph partitioning.
    parallel.distributed
    Extends the basic functionality found in the parallel package over many remote JVMs distributed over a network of machines.
    tests
    tests package: defines functions used for testing the optimization algorithms in the popt4jlib library.
    utils
    utils package: containing useful classes and methods including I/O manipulation.
  • Classes in graph used by graph 
    Class and Description
    AllMWCFinder
    The class computes all maximal weighted cliques in a Graph.
    AllMWCFinderBKMT0.RunBK2Task0 
    AllMWCFinderBKMT2.RunBK2Task2 
    DisjointSetElem
    auxiliary class not part of the public API.
    Graph
    Graph class represents (directed) graphs, and is thread-safe with the exception of the methods ending with "Unsynchronized" which for performance purposes are not.
    GraphException
    Class represents exceptions in graph-related methods in the graph package.
    HGraph
    HGraph class represents hyper-graphs where each edge ("net" to be precise), connects two or more nodes together.
    HLink
    represents nets connecting multiple nodes in hyper-graphs.
    HNode
    the analogue of the Node class for hyper-graphs.
    Link
    represents links between nodes in Graph objects.
    MWCFinderBKMT0.RunBK2Task0 
    Node
    represents nodes in Graph objects.
